i like fun

Great puzzle solving game. In the single player campaign, there's an adequate number of puzzle elements and never too difficult. Community levels are as fun as the main levels, maybe a bit more creative even. The soundtrack is very good. The visual design is highly reminiscent of the eras it tries to convey. 

But what I like most about Portal 2 is something else. As a researcher, it would be impossible for me imagine a better way of introducing someone from outside the field into it. Watching others play years ago helped guide me to this domain; playing it now reminds me why I did and solidifies my decision. The game shows research through humorous, rose-tinted glasses, along the lines of 'How come we have all these fancy results and stuff? Look how far we've gone, we don't know how we got here. Out of resources, but let's keep going for the sake of the idea.' It is precisely how I feel about my current work, too.

I don't know if this was the intention of the developers, but they've contributed something to the scientific community that a publication never could: a gateway for young minds. I perceive this game as an homage to researchers and a masterpiece.

Buen juego, moderniza las mecanicas de la primera entrega dando una mayor profundidad en el universo de este mismo, la musica es la unica parte donde no destaca en excelencia, si bien tiene unos buenos temas pocos son memorables (a gusto personal cara mia es la mejor pieza en el juego, lastima que se escucha solo en los creditos) el modo coperativo cumple su funcion pasar un buen tiempo con amigos, aunque deja que desear ya que las camaras no son dificiles sino largas y tediosas, un poco mas de puzzle en vez de alargar tareas hubiese sido un gran complemento.  a mi punto de vista el juego es un 9.3/10 casi un juego perfecto pero la musica deja un poco que desear
